Reviews.Title: “Making Paris affordable”
Reviews.Author: nlonsasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my sister and Mum at the beginnin of Feb. We had a room each and all were same high standard. They're small but definitely all you need. It was really cold when we visited at the beginning of February and the rooms had a nice temperature and everything was very good. The staff were very helpful, especially the owner with local bus info which made my mum very happy as she found all the steps in the Metro really hard. The only thing I would say is to bring your own toiletries as they only provided a couple of satchets of shower/shampoo in one. It's really good to find somewhere so affordable and nice in a city like Paris, I would definitely return and have already recommeded this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “For a 2* City break, this is spot on”
Reviews.Author: GavTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Prince Eugene as part of a family Birthday excursion for 2 nights in Paris. This hotel catered perfectly for our needs being very well placed to Metro (5 mins straight walk to Nation station) and next to bars and shops selling everything we needed. The rooms are predictably small, but kept immaculately clean and designed with just enough space for convenience. Our party was separated across 3 floors and all had the same guest experience. Upon arrival the receptionist gained directions for travel to our dinner venue and generally service was good. Breakfast was exactly as expected with a selection of pastries, cold meats & cheese with a member of staff providing hot drinks. One minor niggle would be that our towel rail didn't come on overnight; other than this everything else was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, perfect base for a citytrip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: RvDelft
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had a good time. The hotel is very simple and the rooms are small. But the rooms looked nice (very red though) and were very clean. We had a nice bathroom with a small bath, which was also perfectly clean. Nearby is the metro station 'Nation' from which you can go in almost any direction.

Reviews.Title: “gut”
Reviews.Author: yous G
Reviews.Content: a small, but very clean and calm hotel. it's near the place national a very nice area to have a walk through and on sundys there is a flea-market, which is really huge and you can find everything there. the metro is also not far and you can reach all areas/sight seeings very easy. There was one guy at the reception really helpful and very kind giving tips for the good food areas and good clubs. but in the evening there was a not so friendly guy, so the team is still mixed up.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: NessieC
Reviews.Content: I stayed for seven nights and the hotel was generally very good. My very red single room (small double bed) was relatively small but luxurious compared to the broom cupboard I had just come from in London. The bed was comfortable although the pillows took a bit of getting used to, not bolsters just very flat European ones. The room was yet to be fully renovated with no inserts in the wardrobe doors but aside from allowing me to choose my clothes from the bed this was neither here nor there. The wall mounted tv didn't have any channels in English but I soon learned the French for strike and RER lines not running. Having a mini fridge was helpful, there was good cupboard space and a small desk and chair. There wasn't a locked box or safe as I had thought and the hotel didn't seem to have one. The bathroom was luxurious with heated towel rail and free toiletries. The double glazed windows largely drowned out the noise from the protesters and the location would have been excellent if the RER was running.It is near Nation which has multiple metro lines. The internal walls were very thin but I was only disturbed on one night with a very loud group of Germans in the next room. The hotel is on a pretty tree lined street and my room had a lovely view of Boulevard Voltaire. There are small shops nearby to buy drinks etc.and autotellers. The pictures on the website did show what the room was actually like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: DonaBradley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprise when we paid as little as we did. The room, though small, was immaculate and newly refurbished. It was quiet, had air conditioning and the bathroom was perfect for our needs. We only stayed the one night before our journey continued back to the UK but would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A definate repeat”
Reviews.Author: nicerue50
Reviews.Content: Rooms newly remodelled. Excellent location, neighborhood active with restaurants, shopping. Best value for your dollar

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel in lovely neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: americagirl22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this small hotel for 3 nights and it was good. The bathroom was very new and luxurous, the room was a little older and could do with a new carpet. Nevertheless did we have a great stay in this cosy hotel. The neighboorhoud is also very nice, very Parisian and the subway is very close. 5 different subway lines stop there (Nation) so it's easy to get home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, So-so Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperGirl84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on our honeymoon in Paris. After staying at 2 other hotels in Belgium, we were a little disappointed with this specific hotel. We were put in a room that faced a very busy street and the noise kept us up. The weather was quite warm so without the windows open, the room was stuffy and hot. However, due to the noise, we HAD to keep the windows shut. The elevator was broken during our stay and we had to haul our luggage up severl flights of stairs. The hotel DOES offer a breakfast (for a fee), but I saw what it included and would recommend walking down the street to one of the fabulous bakeries and getting something from there. The biggest PRO of this hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! It was a five-minute walk from a metro and from there we could go anywhere in Paris. Just a small tip from me to other travellers: if traveling on a budget, be mindful of the fact that it's cheaper to have drinks and pastries AT THE BAR instead of sitting down. You pay a premium for the wait staff. That is what my husband and I discovered half-way through our trip.

Reviews.Title: “very bad service”
Reviews.Author: gmichels_ext
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel my room was not held for me even though I had a booking confirmation printed out with me and I had paid for the rrom online. I was not provided with any alternatives except to go to another hotel in Vincennes where |I would have been charged 200 euros for a room and I had to pay for the cab as well ( even though I repeat it, I had paid for my room online and so had already been charged by the hotel the prince eugene) The experience I have had with this hotel was terrible and not up what you can expect. I wouldn t recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tipa
Reviews.Content: Will go back here if we go to Paris again Metro/RER 5 mins walk hotel clean and tidy staff nice area okay.

Reviews.Title: “A good safe no frills place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tozmo
Reviews.Content: A good solid safe inexpensive place to stay when visiting Paris. Got the recommendation from a Mexican couple while staying in Bruege, Belgium. An excellent price for a quiet, clean but definitely tight room. Front desk staff friendly and tries to work with us english speakers. Great location close to the Metro and Jim Morrison's final resting place. Spend the money on food and fun in Paris, save it at this hotel. I'd stay there again! Breakfast is not included, but with such great street food in Paris, who cares if you get breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price, but could use an update”
Reviews.Author: rlmorris
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel du Prince Eugene was very pleasant. The rooms are standard size for a 2 star. Our bathroom was the size of a American hotel bathroom (meaning much larger than your standard European one); however, a friend traveling with us had a single room and his bath was much smaller. The staff was very friendly and English speaking. We stayed during a particularly warm weekend in June, so the central AC was very welcome. If you're looking to save money by not staying in the heart of the city, Hotel du Prince Eugene is in a prefect location -- directly in the middle of two seperate subway stations that can get you anywhere you want to go. The subway stops running at 10:00p, so if you stay in the city late at night, you'll have to catch a bus or cab (we chose cab and paid a reasonable 15 Euro). Our only complaint is that the hotel linens really need updating. The blankets were somewhat ratty. The sheets and towels are okay, but they too will soon need replacing. Overall, the hotel was a great value for the low cost (75 Euro/night for the double).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Prince Eugene
HotelInfo.Address: 247 Boulevard Voltaire, 75011 Paris, France
